oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Un nouveau ravageur menaçant pour les cultures fruitières biologiques : Drosophila suzukii
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: WARLOP, FRANCOIS
MANDRIN, Jean-François
Weydert, Claire
Filleron, Emmanuelle
Turquet, Marion
Gallia, Valérie
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fruit and berries
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new pest has been officially described in France in 2010. Drosophila suzukii (also called Spotted-wing Drosophila) attacks many species of fruits, before ripening, and economic consequences are very important. Because of a very high fecundity and a great lack of knowledge on this invasive pest, there is a high need of applied research to provide efficient techniques to conventional and also organic farmers. Indeed, organic cherry or strawberry production is directly threatened by this new pest. The poster presents different control strategies and state of art for each of them.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: WARLOP, FRANCOIS; MANDRIN, Jean-François; Weydert, Claire; Filleron, Emmanuelle; Turquet, Marion and Gallia, Valérie (2013) Un nouveau ravageur menaçant pour les cultures fruitières biologiques : Drosophila suzukii. [A new therat for organic fruit species : Drosophila suzukii.] Poster at: DINABIO 2013, Tours, France, 10-12 november 2013.
